Reported to House from the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1079.

actions.committee: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation with amendment, S. Rept. 95-818.

official_title: An Act to amend the Central, Western, and South Pacific Fisheries Development Act to increase the appropriation authorization through fiscal year 1982, to expand the United States fisheries development effort, and to cooperate in the formation and research of the South Pacific regional fishery agency, and for other purposes.
subjects: Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation with amendment, S. Rept. 95-818) Amends the Central, Western, and South Pacific Fisheries Development Act by authorizing the Secretary of Commerce to carry out development programs by entering into contracts with the Pacific Tuna Development Foundation or another agency or organization. Requires the Secretary to consult with the Secretary of State, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and all appropriate member nations of the South Pacific regional fishery agency in addition to those parties with which the Secretary is presently required to consult. Authorizes the Secretary to develop and carry out a cooperative program for research and development of the fishery resources of the Central, Western, and South Pacific Ocean. Requires the submission of the program to the President and Congress. Stipulates that all member nations shall have access to the results and findings of such research and development projects. Authorizes appropriations of $4,000,000 for fiscal year 1979, and $5,000,000 for fiscal years 1980, 1981, and 1982, to carry out the purposes of such Act.

titles.title: A bill to authorize appropriations to carry out the Central, Western, and South Pacific Fisheries Development Act until the close of fiscal year 1983.

An Act to amend the Central, Western, and South Pacific Fisheries Development Act to increase the appropriation authorization through fiscal year 1982, to expand the United States fisheries development effort, and to cooperate in the formation and research of the South Pacific regional fishery agency, and for other purposes.
